author: Dave Michaels
title: Appeals Court Exempts Loan Funds from Dodd-Frank Risk-Retention Rule
text:
WASHINGTON—Managers of Wall Street funds that lend money to heavily indebted firms won’t have to retain an interest in the debt they sell to investors after a federal appeals court invalidated part of a major postcrisis rule.
The U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit on Friday overturned regulators’ decision to apply a 2014 rule to managers of funds known as collateralized-loan obligations. The rule sought to impose discipline on banks and other mortgage lenders that had spun risky home loans into securities,...
